channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025040144
item.description:
Report E-2025040144

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: EL DORADO
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: B-ANN DISTRIBUTING CO., L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 33000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: B-Ann Driver was dispatched for a power unit only load for Southwest Logistics/ OFS Inc. B-Ann Driver picked up trailer #463 in OKC and picked up a load of Ferric Chloride in Russelville Arkansas and Delivered to Topeka, KS. The driver noticed a tire separating on the trailer, he contacted Southwest Logistics/OFS Inc dispatch for direction on where to go for repairs. Southwest Logistics dispatcher sent B-Ann Driver to Loves truck stop El Dorado KS. Upon arrival B-Ann Driver noticed a leak on the trailer. He contacted Southwest Logistics Dispatcher, who contacted Don Cox. OFS INC/ Southwest Logistics Safety Manager, Don Cox then contacted Boomer Enviriomental to contain and Clean up spill

item.title: Report E-2025040107
item.description:
Report E-2025040107

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking poly tote containing hazardous product, Barquat MB-50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 140-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor, the concrete beneath the trailer, the asphalt parking lot, and the soil. The trailer floor was impacted in a 20’ x 8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer, asphalt, and soil were impacted in a 100’ x 75’ area. The contractor neutralized the release and applied oil dry. A vac truck extracted approximately 2,700-gallons of impacted rainwater and containerized it into one vac box. Three 55-gallon DF’s containing the cut-up tote, impacted oil dry, and impacted PPE were also generated. ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac box. XPO will manage the drum waste created from the response. No storm-drains or waterways were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040119
item.description:
Report E-2025040119

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: Labadie
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KIESEL CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 288295
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver exited Hwy MM, turning on Hwy T, the front right steer tire side wall ruptured, sending the truck into a 20' ditch. The tractor and trailer rolled on its side, slid across 2 more ditches and then the fifth wheel broke and the tractor continued sliding and came to rest in the final ditch. The 1st compartment of the trailer ruptured and approx 1,475 gallons of diesel fuel was released. The temperature was below freezing, the ditches were frozen and the red dye diesel stayed in the snow and on top of the ice. Kiesel sent a cleanup crew and vacuum trucks to empty the remaining contents of the trailer and vacuum up free liquids. The recovered materials were transported to the Kiesel terminal. Dams were created in the ditches under the oversight of the USEPA and Missouri Department of Natural Resources to prevent spread of contamination. When the snow melted, cleaning of the ditches commenced. All of the dams except for 1 have been removed and the cleanup is in its final stage. Contaminated soils have been excavated and transported to Waste Management Milam Landfill. All response operations performed with approval of USEPA.
